title: Chapter 1 – Practice: Hello, Python!
description: Hands-on missions for chapter 1 using script mode and basic Python concepts.

practices.title: Mission: Boot Up Your First Script

solution.notes: Program must print exactly 'Hello, World!' with the same capitalization, comma, exclamation mark, and a newline. Optional extra experiments should come after you pass this check.
After fixing and uncommenting, running the script should output exactly 'Hello, World!' followed by a newline. You can customize it later, but make sure this basic version works first.

solution.exampleImplementation:
print('This is my first script line!')
print('This is my second line.')
print('This is my third line.')
solution.expectedStdout:
This is my first script line!
This is my second line.
This is my third line.
solution.notes: Validator can check that there are at least three print statements and at least three non-empty output lines. Feel free to change the messages as long as the structure stays the same.

practices.title: Mission: Simple Script — Print three lines

solution.notes: Script-mode version: the validator should run the script and compare stdout exactly to the three lines shown in the assignment.

programmingLinesShouldContain: Step 1: Decide what the program should do.
Step 2: We want to greet the user with their name.
Plan: If the user does not type anything, we will still say hello.
Step 3: Later we could add more features, like asking for their age.

solution.notes: Validation can check for markers like '# PROGRAMMING' on planning lines and '# CODE' on real code lines. The main goal is to understand the difference, not to trick you.
